thread.title: Nazareth girls soccer team uses speech to inspire victory
thread.title_full: Nazareth girls soccer team uses speech to inspire victory

title: Nazareth girls soccer team uses speech to inspire victory
text:
After disappointing results in the last two games, the Nazareth girls soccer team was looking for some inspiration before Thursday's matchup against Central Catholic. 
The Blue Eagles found it in the words of their coach Ziggy Lewis. 
"We had a speech yesterday, kind of what drives us to play soccer and I think it got us really pumped up," Nazareth junior defender Holly Lunt said. "We're out here because we love the game." 
Nazareth looked ready to go as it got two early goals from senior forward Amy Strauser on its way to a 2-0 road win over the Vikings. 
"We talked about what motivates us to play this game and how getting to districts and playoffs and doing well in those games is a really big accomplishment for all of us and means a lot," Strauser said. 
RELATED: Nazareth girls soccer team wins 'most important game of the season' 
The Blue Eagles improved to 10-4-2 on the season and have earned a spot in the District 11 playoffs. They finish up the regular season with a road game against Dieruff on Saturday and a home matchup against Northampton on Wednesday as they look to secure their spot in the Eastern Pennsylvania Conference playoffs. 
After Emmaus scored in the final seconds to tie Nazareth on Saturday and Whitehall posted a win over the Blue Eagles on Tuesday, the performance against Central Catholic was just what Nazareth needed. 
"I think it's going to pick us up. Give us the momentum to carry us through and hopefully do well in district playoffs," Lunt said. 
"Overall, our energy level is up and we'll go out hard in the next games," Strauser said.
